name: Remote Multiplexer
short_description:
This project aims to provide a generic remote control protocol as well as a reference implementation server and clients.

A central server is used to maintain a network of attached remote controllers, feedback devices (displays and speakers), and controllable applications.

The protocol, built on top of TCP/IP, allows attaching physically separated devices within the same control domain while clients may expand the system over alternative hardware communication methods.

As an example, a 'controller' type client may receive IR commands from a conventional remote controller and transcode the command to the remote control server.
